item.title: Shana add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Some knowledge is too heavy...you cannot bear it...your Father will carry it until you are able." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Shana add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "And so seated next to my father in the train compartment, I suddenly asked, "Father, what is sexsin?" He turned to look at me, as he always did when answering a question, but to my surprise he said nothing. At last he stood up, lifted his traveling case off the floor and set it on the floor. Will you carry it off the train, Corrie?" he said. I stood up and tugged at it. It was crammed with the watches and spare parts he had purchased that morning. It's too heavy," I said. Yes," he said, "and it would be a pretty poor father who would ask his little girl to carry such a load. It's the same way, Corrie, with knowledge. Some knowledge is too heavy for children. When you are older and stronger, you can bear it. For now you must trust me to carry it for you." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Shana add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "There are no 'if's' in God's world. And no places that are safer than other places. The center of His will is our only safety - let us pray that we may always know it!" -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Shana add a quote by Hudson Taylor
item.description: "God's work done in God's way will never lack God's provision." -- Hudson Taylor

item.title: Shana add a quote by J. Hudson Taylor
item.description: "Not by discussions nor by argument, but by lifting up Christ shall we draw men unto Him." -- J. Hudson Taylor

item.title: Shana add a quote by Hudson Taylor
item.description: "it is no small comfort to me to know that God has called me to my work, putting me where I am and as I am. I have not sought the position, and I dare not leave it. He knows why He places me here-whether to do, or learn, or suffer." -- Hudson Taylor

item.title: Shana add a quote by Hudson Taylor
item.description: "There are three stages to every great work of God; first it is impossible, then it is difficult, then it is done." -- Hudson Taylor

item.title: Shana add a quote by Hudson Taylor
item.description: "When I cannot read, when I cannot think, when I cannot even pray, I can trust." -- Hudson Taylor

item.title: Shana add a quote by J. Hudson Taylor
item.description: "All God's giants have been weak men who did great things for God because they reackoned on God being with them." -- J. Hudson Taylor
